channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OH

item.title: Report X-2024071583
item.description:
Report X-2024071583

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-30T12:20:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-11
  • City: RICHFIELD
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hazmat was found at door 125 in the load end ready to go to the next load point. The outbound sort manager walked passed it and noticed a very strong odor coming from the box. QA was contacted immediately to inspect the box. I noticed a little wet spot on one of the bottom corners of the package and brought it over to the office in a lined tote for further inspection. The inner drum seamed to have a poor quality closure that caused some of the contents to spill out and make it a little noticeable to the naked eye. Once the package was fully opened, the corrugated liner seamed to be wet also to confirm that the hazmat was damaged and could have possibly been damaged while it was on the vehicle when the driver returned from the pick up but could have dried do to the Acetone & Isopropyl Alcohol ingredient that makes up the product.

item.title: Report E-2024070659
item.description:
Report E-2024070659

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-30T12:20:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-03
  • City: AUSTINTOWN
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ADVANTAGE MANAGEMENT GROUP, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5215000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC unit was traveling westbound on I 76 near Austintown, Ohio. The KAG Energy, LLC unit drifted off the roadway and struck an abandoned vehicle on the shoulder of the highway. The KAG Energy, LLC unit then went off the roadway and rolled over. Approximately 4572 gallons of cutback asphalt was released. The released product impacted a nearby stream and reservoir. Hepaco Environmental and Enviroserve are continuing to remediate the site.

item.title: Report E-2024070065
item.description:
Report E-2024070065

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-30T12:20:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-26
  • City: ASHTABULA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5010
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 6/26/2024, at 1048 hours, personnel in the CSXT Ashtabula Yard discovered TILX 113642, a residue tank car of Hydrochloric Acid, leaking from the protective housing area. The car was isolated and the shipper, INEOS, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report #2024-0626-143). EnviroServe, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the primary liquid line closure flange not properly prepared for transportation. Contractor personnel properly secured the closure and decontaminated the car. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative- Jeanne Kochevar (440-228-8373).

item.title: Report E-2024070648
item.description:
Report E-2024070648

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-29T09:15:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-18
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 18, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3082 was punctured during unloading and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN3082-impacted trailer floor and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into two (2) 35-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024070576
item.description:
Report E-2024070576

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-25T15:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-19
  • City: PERRYSBURG
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately half a gallon (.5) due to a load shift that crushed one (1) 1-gallon metal pail. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel clean the impacted area and containerized the cleanup debris into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024070516
item.description:
Report E-2024070516

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-24T15:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-18
  • City: MANSFIELD
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) cup of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to a small puncture in the body of the drum. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and containerize the recovered spent absorbents and the damaged drum into one (1) 85-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight ’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024070515
item.description:
Report E-2024070515

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-24T15:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-18
  • City: KENT
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) liter of material released from one (1) 5-gallon plastic jerrycan due to a load shift during transit. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned the impacted area, and the cleanup debris was containerized into one (1) 15-gallon poly drum along with the damaged jerrycan. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
